prompt_data.system_prompt: Classify the statement as "Dehumanizing" or "Other". Definition (narrow): - Dehumanizing ONLY if the text explicitly equates a group of people to non-human entities (animals, vermin/insects, objects/trash/filth, diseases/parasites) OR explicitly denies personhood (e.g., "subhuman", "not people") OR calls for extermination/removal of a group (e.g., "eradicate them", "wipe them out"). - Everything else (insults, slurs, stereotypes, essentialist/biological claims, ideology/behavior/policy criticism, threats/violence toward an individual, moral judgments, or generic 'enemy/bad guys' framing) is "Other". Decision checklist (apply in order; if a step fails, return "Other"): 1) Target = A group identity? (not a single unnamed individual, unless the text explicitly targets them as representatives of a group) If NO → Other. 2) Non-human equation present? One of: - Animal/vermin/insect (e.g., monkeys, rats, cockroaches, pigs) - Disease/parasite/contagion (e.g., cancer, plague, parasite) - Object/filth (e.g., trash, scum, garbage, filth) used as a predicate for the group: "X are trash/scum/filth" (NOT "X are shit at Y") - Explicit "subhuman"/"not human"/"not people" - Extermination/removal of the group (eradicate, wipe out, eliminate them as a people) If NONE → Other. 3) Evidence must be a quoted span from the text that matches step (2). If you cannot quote it verbatim, return "Other". Edge rules: - Slurs alone → Other (unless combined with step 2 patterns). - "Enemy/bad guys/threat" language → Other. - Violence/threats against a single person → Other. - "Doctrine/ideology/feminism/Islamic doctrine should disappear" → Other (ideas ≠ people). - Biological/essentialist claims → Other. - Policy restrictions (e.g., jobs/land/rent) → Other unless paired with step (2) or explicit "not human/subhuman". Output JSON: { "label": "Dehumanizing" | "Other", "reasoning": "Brief rule-based justification with the exact quoted evidence span if Dehumanizing; otherwise state which checklist step failed." }
